comments:
Copied from bug 154748:

If I try to close editor before uninstalling the bundle, following exception
occur on trying to exit workbench:

org.eclipse.core.runtime.InvalidRegistryObjectException: Invalid registry
object
        at
org.eclipse.core.internal.registry.TemporaryObjectManager.getObject(TemporaryObjectManager.java:98)
        at
org.eclipse.core.internal.registry.ConfigurationElementHandle.getConfigurationElement(ConfigurationElementHandle.java:26)
        at
org.eclipse.core.internal.registry.ConfigurationElementHandle.getAttribute(ConfigurationElementHandle.java:34)
        at
org.eclipse.ui.internal.registry.EditorDescriptor.getId(EditorDescriptor.java:260)
        at
org.eclipse.ui.internal.EditorHistoryItem.saveState(EditorHistoryItem.java:225)
        at
org.eclipse.ui.internal.EditorHistory.saveState(EditorHistory.java:152)
        at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.saveState(Workbench.java:1953)

The reason: IEditorPart instance passed into EditorManager.removeExtension() in
this case has no IEditorInput (null returned from editor.getEditorInput() call)
as a result, corresponding IEditorInput will not be removed from EditorHistory
on attempt to uninstall bundle with Editor and Workbench fails on saving the
state.

Shouldn't we remove EditorHistoryItem from EditorHistory on closing
corresponding editor to get rid of these problems?

Maybe we can do something with the ordering.
PW
